citations.narrative:
During inspection it was found that the licensee was not using the Record of Acquisition and Dogs and Cats on Hand
(APHIS Form 7005) or the Record of Disposition of Dogs and Cats (APHIS Form 7006). An accurate animal inventory is
required so that USDA inspectors can ensure all dogs are accounted for and receiving adequate veterinary care. Records
of animal acquisition and disposition, including births and deaths, must be kept by the facility to ensure animals can be
traced in case of an animal disease outbreak and to ensure there are not high mortality rates in the animals. An accurate
inventory and records of animal acquisition and disposition using Forms 7005 and 7006, including births and death, must
be maintained by the facility.
To be corrected by January 19, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.75(a)(2) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
During inspection it was found that the licensee was not using the Record of Acquisition and Dogs and Cats on Hand 
(APHIS Form 7005) or the Record of Disposition of Dogs and Cats (APHIS Form 7006). An accurate animal inventory is 
required so that USDA inspectors can ensure all dogs are accounted for and receiving adequate veterinary care. Records 
of animal acquisition and disposition, including births and deaths, must be kept by the facility to ensure animals can be 
traced in case of an animal disease outbreak and to ensure there are not high mortality rates in the animals. An accurate 
inventory and records of animal acquisition and disposition using Forms 7005 and 7006, including births and death, must 
be maintained by the facility.  
To be corrected by January 19, 2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
